definition: a familiy of wireless communication technologies for exchanging data over short distances (using short-wavelength UHF radio waves in the ISM band from 2.4 to 2.485 GHz[3]) from fixed and mobile devices. Variations of Bluetooth are many, including Bluetooth Low Energy, Class 1 Bluetooth (for communications over 100m, up to 1km) and Class 2 Bluetooth (10-20m range).
